channel.title: I have a virus,but its not what you think:its not activated yet
channel.description:
I really hate chinese,even though I am one myself.
VIRUS SCANS DO NOT PICK UP ANYTHING I was playing maplestory when I went to this fansite.It was wierd,think it had a virus. After I started up the computer the next day,I came up with a chinese warning,at the WINDOWS IS STARTING UP PART A translated version.
You could be a victim of piracy. This is not the real windows,please go to http://www.microsoft.com/genuine to get the genuine windows Next:there is another screen saying would you like to download it now?(yes/no) Yes is obviously activating a virus The problem: Whenever you see windows you see a little TM at the top right?Now it has 2 little white boxes. And my settings are to english not chinese..... MY WINDOWS IS GENUINE
Could anyone help?I have not activated it yet

item.title: I have a virus,but its not what you think:its not activated yet
item.dc:creator: @gsp gsp
item.description:
@gsp wrote:

Ron:

Get Linux, no more problems.

i got linux and i got many problems

the real geniue windows is also annoying as well, i had once cut off my power to upgrade some stuff in my mother board, then that thing sure pop up, because my clock was not set! i have to synchronise my PC clock to make that thing disappear, it is madness

Read full topic

item.title: I have a virus,but its not what you think:its not activated yet
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Hopefully it’s the Windows XP with Service Pack 2 disk.

We had the original Windows XP Professional disk without Service Pack 2. Then we installed Service Pack 2 and tried to fix the missing dlls and such, and it said Unrecognized Disk or some bullshit like that. Microsoft, what a bunch of assholes.

@Greeny wrote:

I think the Chinese owned you. Go beat one with a stick and ask for the remover.

Alternativly, insert your Windows XP disk and do the windows overlay thing, the one which doesnt completely re-install it just fixes any missing DLLs, and it will probably sort your problem. Once its done everything should be as it was.

@Martin wrote:

Ok well then press ctrl-alt-del find the process and end it
go to start>run> type msconfig then go to the startup tab and untick the process u ended
if this dosent work try www.google.com ive found out one or two things useing google.
